audio_script:
Welcome to our lesson on the present tense in Modern Greek! This is a fundamental part of speaking and understanding Greek, and our textbook, 'Modern Greek: Grammar Notes for Absolute Beginners,' makes it quite manageable. Let's dive in!

In Modern Greek, verbs change their endings to show who is performing the action – that's person – and whether it's one person or more – that's number. This is called conjugation. Today, we'll focus on the present tense. Our textbook groups verbs into different categories based on how they conjugate in the present. Let's look at them.

First, we have Group A1, with the verb κάνω, meaning 'to do' or 'to make'. Here's how it conjugates:
Εγώ κάνω... (I do/make)
Εσύ κάνεις... (You do/make)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό κάνει... (He/She/It does/makes)
Εμείς κάνουμε... (We do/make)
Εσείς κάνετε... (You plural do/make)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά κάνουν. (They do/make)

Next is Group A2, featuring the verb τρώω, meaning 'to eat'. Notice the slight changes:
Εγώ τρώω... (I eat)
Εσύ τρως... (You eat)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό τρώει... (He/She/It eats)
Εμείς τρώμε... (We eat)
Εσείς τρώτε... (You plural eat)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά τρώνε. (They eat)

Then we have Group B1, with verbs like μιλάω, or its contracted form μιλώ, meaning 'to speak'.
Εγώ μιλάω ή μιλώ... (I speak)
Εσύ μιλάς ή μιλάς... (You speak)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό μιλάει ή μιλά... (He/She/It speaks)
Εμείς μιλάμε ή μιλάμε... (We speak)
Εσείς μιλάτε ή μιλάτε... (You plural speak)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά μιλάνε ή μιλάνε. (They speak)

Group B2 includes verbs like μπορώ, meaning 'to be able to' or 'can'.
Εγώ μπορώ... (I can)
Εσύ μπορείς... (You can)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό μπορεί... (He/She/It can)
Εμείς μπορούμε... (We can)
Εσείς μπορείτε... (You plural can)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά μπορούν. (They can)

Our textbook also introduces 'passive' verbs. While they might look different, they follow similar patterns. Let's look at 'Passive' Group 1, with έρχομαι, meaning 'to come'.
Εγώ έρχομαι... (I come)
Εσύ έρχεσαι... (You come)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό έρχεται... (He/She/It comes)
Εμείς ερχόμαστε... (We come)
Εσείς έρχεστε... (You plural come)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά έρχονται. (They come)

And 'Passive' Group 2, with θυμάμαι, meaning 'to remember'.
Εγώ θυμάμαι... (I remember)
Εσύ θυμάσαι... (You remember)
Αυτός/Αυτή/Αυτό θυμάται... (He/She/It remembers)
Εμείς θυμόμαστε... (We remember)
Εσείς θυμάστε... (You plural remember)
Αυτοί/Αυτές/Αυτά θυμούνται. (They remember)

The key takeaway from our textbook is that learning Modern Greek verbs in the present tense can be simplified into two steps:
Step 1: Identify which group the verb belongs to.
Step 2: Apply the correct endings for that group.

It might seem like a lot, but with practice, these patterns will become second nature. Keep practicing these conjugations, and you'll be speaking Greek in no time!
